record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, DECEMBER 11, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, DECEMBER 11, 2007 -- (Senate - December 10, 2007)

[Page: S15081]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m., Tuesday, December 11; that on Tuesday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour deemed expired, the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period of morning business for 60 minutes, with time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees; and Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes, with the first half under the control of the Republicans and the final half under the control of the majority; that at the close of morning business, the Senate then resume consideration of H.R. 2419.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
